pinyin: chī bǎo le fàn chēng de

etymology.description: 吃 + 饱(了) + 饭 + 撑 + 的 = so full from a meal that one is 'propped up'/overstuffed → idle meddling, nothing better to do.
etymology.interpretation: Pejorative way to say someone is fussing or meddling because they're overfed and bored. Often used to scold needless or time-wasting behavior.
etymology.simplification: 饱、饭 use the simplified food radical 饣 (for 飠); 撑 simplifies 撐 by replacing the complex right side with the phonetic 争; 吃、了、的 unchanged.

parts.english: to eat; to consume; to suffer (endure); to erode
full (after eating); satiated; replete; to satisfy
completed-action particle; change-of-state particle; (modal) particle; to finish
to prop up; to support; to hold up; to overstuff
structural particle; possessive marker; nominalizer; modifier marker

examples.chinese: 你这是吃饱了饭撑的吧(你這是吃飽了飯撐的吧)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhè shì chī bǎo le fàn chēng de ba.
examples.english: Are you doing this just because you’re overfed and bored?

examples.chinese: 少管闲事(少管閒事)，别老是吃饱了饭撑的(別老是吃飽了飯撐的)。
examples.pinyin: Shǎo guǎn xiánshì, bié lǎo shì chī bǎo le fàn chēng de.
examples.english: Mind your own business; stop wasting time with pointless stuff.

examples.chinese: 你成天挑别人毛病(你成天挑別人毛病)，简直是吃饱了饭撑的(簡直是吃飽了飯撐的)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ chéngtiān tiāo biérén máobìng, jiǎnzhí shì chī bǎo le fàn chēng de.
examples.english: You nitpick all day—clearly just have nothing better to do.
